articles.title: DPRK to Hold Six-party Talks without Preconditions
articles.content:
DPRK to Hold Six-party Talks without Preconditions

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA Monday following the DPRK-U.S. high-ranking talks held in New York, U.S.:
					
					 The DPRK delegation led by First Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Kye Gwan visited the U.S. at the invitation of the U.S. government. It held high-ranking talks with the U.S. delegation led by Special Representative for the DPRK Policy Stephen Bosworth in New York from July 28 to 29. 
					
					 The talks had an in-depth discussion on the issues of improving the DPRK-U.S. relations, ensuring stability on the Korean Peninsula and resuming the six-party talks in a sincere and constructive atmosphere.
					
					 Both sides recognized that the improvement of the bilateral relations and the peaceful negotiated settlement of the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula conform with the interests of the two sides and agreed to further dialogue.
					
					 The DPRK remains unchanged in its stand to resume the six-party talks without preconditions at an early date and comprehensively implement the September 19 joint statement on the principle of simultaneous action.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Benin
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Benin

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on July 28 sent a message of greeting to Thomas Boni Yayi, president of Benin, on the 51st anniversary of its independence.
					
					 Expressing belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop in various fields, Kim in the message wished the friendly people of Benin progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Swiss President
articles.content:
Greetings to Swiss President

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a massage of greeting to Micheline Calmy-Rey, president of Switzerland, on its national holiday.
					
					 Kim in the message wished the president success in his work for the prosperity of the country and well-being of its people, expressing the belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Switzerland would grow stronger.

articles.title: Just Actions against S. Korean Unpopular Educational Policy Supported
articles.content:
Just Actions against S. Korean Unpopular Educational Policy Supported

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Teachers Sub-Committee of the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration released the following statement on Monday as regards the dynamic actions of south Korean youth and students and other people for getting the issue of the  university registration fee solved.
					
					 South Korea is now swept by the waves of dynamic actions of youth and students and other people denouncing the puppet group for reneging on its promise to halve the registration fee and demanding its sharp reduction.
					
					 These actions that were kicked off to win back the freedom and right of learning mercilessly violated by the present regime's unpopular educational policy are now escalating into a mass struggle thanks to the positive support and solidarity of at least 550 civic and public organizations grouping various circles of south Korea. Amid the angry shouts of "Let's bring down the society ill-famed for crazy registration fee!" that shook the whole land of south Korea, there picked up the atmosphere of protest such as demonstrations, candlelight rallies and one-million signature campaign.
					
					 The Teachers Sub-Committee of the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration along with the educators and people in the north expresses full support to the youth and students and all other people in south Korea in their just struggle.
					
					 Desire for learning is the universally recognized right of a human being.
					
					 But the puppet authorities threw away their big promise to halve the registration fee like a pair of old shoes and are imposing unaffordable registration fee upon youth and students, denying their opportunity of learning and bringing pain and misfortune to the people.
					
					 Students are being expelled from universities for failing to pay expenses which snowball every year and many of them are toiling and moiling at work sites to earn money to pay the registration fee. And not a few youth and students are dying of hard labor or committing suicides, cursing the grief-stricken society.
					
					 How many parents of students have taken their own lives in protest against the puppet ruling forces out of their great worry about the school fee of their children.
					
					 The sky-rocketing registration fee, a natural product of the puppet authorities' unpopular educational policy, has deprived youth and students of their right to learning and hope, driving them and their parents into despair and death.
					
					 It is due to this unaffordable educational fee that young people and their parents are committing suicides out of extreme unrest with their grudge unsettled. This tragic reality goes to patently show that south Korea is a land of destitution and a tundra of human rights and hopeless dark society.
					
					 It once again clearly proves that it is impossible to realize the dream of the youth and students to have ample opportunity of learning and meet the desire of their parents to bring their children a bright future and get the people's genuine rights guaranteed as long as the group of traitors is allowed to remain in power as it is only keen on staying in it, utterly indifferent to the fate of the people.
					
					 There is nothing to expect from the puppet group any longer as it has brought only unspeakable misfortune and sufferings to the south Korean people with false commitments and rhetoric.
					
					 The people of various circles in south Korea should further intensify actions for getting the registration fee halved and bring the puppet group of traitors without equals to ruin and achieve democracy, civic rights and true life as early as possible.

articles.title: Performance of Extravaganza "Arirang" Begins
articles.content:
Performance of Extravaganza "Arirang" Begins

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The performance of the grand gymnastic and artistic extravaganza "Arirang", a winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, began with due ceremony at the May Day Stadium in Pyongyang on Monday evening on the 63rd anniversary of the birthday of the DPRK.
					
					 "Arirang" gave its premiere in 2002.
					
					 The creating staff produced new scenes depicting the mental power of the servicepersons and people of the DPRK who have brought about eye-opening events under the leadership of the great party and its proud appearance.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Ki Nam and Choe Ryong Hae, secretaries of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, DPRK Vice-Premier Kang Nung Su, officials of working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons of the People's Army and working people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Present there on invitation were overseas compatriots and foreign guests.
					
					 An Tong Chun, minister of Culture, said in his speech that "Arirang" would instill fresh energy and courage into the servicepersons and people and demonstrate the appearance of single-mindedly united socialist Korea and the wisdom and talents of Koreans.
					
					 As the melody of the song "His Ideal" resounded forth, such slogans as "Highest Tribute to the Great Leader, Father of Nation" and "Highest Glory to the Great Leader Comrade Kim Jong Il" appeared on the background one after another. When the performance started, the entire stadium turned into a huge sea of cheering performers and dancers. 
					
					 The performers made a grand epic representation of the exploits President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed for the era, the revolution, the country and its people and all the servicepersons and people working miracles and feats in the efforts to improve the standard of people's living and build a thriving country.
					
					 The performance was highly acclaimed by the audience for presenting fantastic scenes of fascinating art in three-dimensional space, a perfect combination of modern sound and lighting effect, electronic displays, beautiful rhythms and dynamic gymnastics, ever-changing background, etc.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Marked

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- A Pyongyang meeting took place at the Central Hall of Workers Monday to mark the 20th anniversary of the publication of President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Achieve the Great Unity of Our Nation".
					
					 The work, published on August 1, Juche 80 (1991), indicates the fundamental principles for achieving the great national unity, the issue of achieving unity on the basis of patriotism and the spirit of the national independence and the issue of promoting contacts and dialogue between compatriots in the north, the south and abroad. It also comprehensively expounds the tasks and ways for achieving the great national unity.
					
					 Attending the meeting were Yang Hyong Sop, Kim Yang Gon and others, officials of public organizations and working people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea and vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, said in his report that the work is a library of the great national unity that scientifically indicates the issues of nation and reunification on the basis of the Juche idea. The work also serves as a reunification program that clarifies the goal and orientation of the struggle for opening a decisive phase of national reunification through the harmony and unity of all the Koreans.
					
					 The President wisely led the Koreans in their efforts to realize the idea and line of the great national unity and accomplish the cause of national reunification, he said, and went on:
					
					 The President's idea of the great national unity and the cause of national reunification are being successfully carried out thanks to the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il provided the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, its practical programme, and ushered in a new era of achieving the unity of the nation and the independent reunification under the banner of "By our nation itself".
					
					 Thanks to the programme of the great national unity provided by the President and the Songun revolutionary idea and outstanding leadership pursued by Kim Jong Il, the nation is sure to be reunified, the reporter said, calling upon all the Koreans in the north, the south and abroad to vigorously step up the general onward advance for the country's reunification.

articles.title: Reception Given at DPRK Embassy in Moscow
articles.content:
Reception Given at DPRK Embassy in Moscow

					Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The DPRK embassy in Moscow gave a reception on July 29 to mark the 10th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's historic visit to Russia and the adoption of the DPRK-Russia Moscow Declaration.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Aleksei Borodavkin, vice foreign minister of Russia, and other officials of ministries of Foreign Affairs, Agriculture, Regional Development and Extraordinary Situation and the Russian Railways Company.
					
					 Ambassador Kim Yong Jae and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Moscow attended.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.
					
					 Kim Yong Jae said he was pleased with the traditional DPRK-Russia friendly and cooperative relations that have steadily developed on good terms in the spirit of the joint documents signed by the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 He noted the DPRK would value this relationship and strive to boost the ties of good neighborliness and friendship.
					
					 Aleksei Borodavkin said the joint documents signed by the top leaders of the two countries are playing an important role not only in developing the DPRK-Russia relations but in ensuring the peace and security in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world. This has been proved by the reality of the past decade, he added.
					
					 He noted Russia would make efforts for the bilateral relations and the regional peace and security in the spirit of the joint documents, in the future, too.

articles.title: National Day of Switzerland Observed in DPRK
articles.content:
National Day of Switzerland Observed in DPRK

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Katharina Zellweger, country director of the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation in DPRK, Monday gave a reception on the Swiss national day.
					
					 Present there on invitation were officials concerned of the DPRK, diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 Members of the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation were on hand. 
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.
					
					 A piano concert was given at Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory on the same day to mark the Swiss national day.

articles.title: Typhoon, Heavy Rain Cause Damage in DPRK
articles.content:
Typhoon, Heavy Rain Cause Damage in DPRK

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The DPRK suffered human and material losses caused by typhoon-5 and torrential rains from late June to mid-July.
					
					 According to data available, windstorms and flood left dozens of people dead, wounded and missing.
					
					 Over 2,900 dwelling houses were wrecked throughout the country, 2,200 houses in South Hwanghae Province alone. More than 8,000 people are now living in makeshift buildings.
					
					 Nearly 60,000 hectares of farmland were submerged, buried or washed away, with this year's grain output of the country likely to be seriously affected by the damage.
					
					 An estimated 170 industrial facilities and public buildings collapsed and landslides and broken revetments severed roads and bridges.
					
					 Besides, some 300 light poles, including a high-tension tower, fell down, cutting off electricity supply, while more than 8 400 roadside trees went over.

articles.title: New Postage Stamp Issued
articles.content:
New Postage Stamp Issued

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The DPRK State Stamp Bureau recently issued a new stamp to mark the 10th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and the European Union (EU).
					
					 Seen in the sheet is a photo of General Secretary Kim Jong Il receiving a visiting top-level EU delegation in May Juche 90 (2001.)
					
					 The DPRK and EU opened diplomatic relations on May 14, 2001.
					
					 Over the last decade, the DPRK has exchanged high-level delegations with EU and its member nations and cooperated with them in various fields. 
					
					 EU decided to render emergency food assistance to the DPRK some time ago.

articles.title: "Pomhyanggi" Cosmetics Enjoy Popularity
articles.content:
"Pomhyanggi" Cosmetics Enjoy Popularity

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- "Pomhyanggi"-trademarked cosmetics made in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have won a high reputation at domestic and foreign markets.
					
					 With Kaesong Koryo Insam (ginseng), known worldwide as good medicinal stuff and tonic, as principal raw material, the cosmetics include nutritive ingredients and natural active substances necessary for preventing skin ageing and promoting cell reproduction.
					
					 The principal materials is mixed with extracts from over 30 species of rare herbs growing in Mt. Myohyang and Mt. Rangnim, as well as functional substances obtained by bio-engineering technologies.
					
					 The cosmetics number 42 in shape and variety, typical of them being Kaesong Koryo Insam lotion, liquid cream, whitening lotion, whitening cream and transparent soap.
					
					 The products won high appreciation from SGS and were awarded ISO 9001.
					
					 An Ok, an official of the Pomhyanggi Joint-venture Company, told KCNA the company is always ready to render kind services to all clients.

articles.title: Taedonggang, Favorite Term of Korean People
articles.content:
Taedonggang, Favorite Term of Korean People

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- There are many things named after Taedonggang (River Taedong) in the DPRK.
					
					 Included in the factories named after Taedonggang are a bear factory, tile factory, eel breeding farm, combined fruit farm, combined fruit processing factory, pig farm and net factory.
					
					 From ancient times the Korean people had created their peculiar culture in the areas with the Taedong River basin as the centre. The Taedong River culture is viewed as one of the world's five ancient cultures.
					
					 Modern industrial establishments named after Taedonggang have appeared one after another in the country in the new century.

articles.title: Guidelines for Great Unity of Korean Nation
articles.content:
Guidelines for Great Unity of Korean Nation

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung published the famous work "Let Us Achieve the Great Unity of Our Nation" on August 1, Juche 80 (1991) to provide guidelines for bringing about a fresh upsurge in the effort for the country's reunification.
					
					 In the work the President, based on great feats and rich experience he gained in the protracted revolutionary struggle, gave a comprehensive and detailed exposition of the idea of great national unity and theoretical and practical issues concerning its implementation.
					
					 The work says great national unity is essential to the country's independent and peaceful reunification, the unity should be based on patriotism and spirit of national independence and that the nation's concord and reunification should be achieved through federation. It also calls for giving priority to common interests of the nation irrespective of difference in ideology, social system and religious belief, and developing contact, visit and dialogue and strengthening solidarity among Korean people at home and abroad.
					
					 All these ideas and theories expounded in the work serve as guidelines for the country's reunification.  
					
					 The June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, adopted in the new century as a milestone for national reunification, and the October 4 Declaration, adopted for its implementation, reflect the President's idea of great national unity. They have turned the effort for realizing the nation's desire for reunification into the cause to be accomplished by the Korean nation itself.
					
					 Now those seeking confrontation among the fellow countrymen and the country's permanent division have come to an unprecedented crisis and the Koreans have become more ardent in their desire to see relations between the north and the south improved and the country reunified at an early date, with their concerted effort.
					
					 The present situation clearly proves the validity and great vitality of the idea of great national unity.

articles.title: S. Korea- US Plan for Cooperation in War of Aggression Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korea- US Plan for Cooperation in War of Aggression Flayed

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the south Korean authorities discussed with the U.S. a scenario for a war of aggression against the DPRK at the meeting of the committee for logistic cooperation of the 43rd "annual security consultative meeting" held at the U.S. Pacific Command in Hawaii. Meanwhile, the south Korean authorities are contemplating staging large-scale joint military exercisers Ulji Freedom Guardian in collusion with the U.S. from August 16 to 26.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					This is a deliberate provocation intended to chill the atmosphere of dialogue and further strain the situation on the Korean Peninsula to all intents and purposes. 
					
					 They held such a dangerous confab with the U.S. to do harm to the DPRK in "contingency" under the pretext of logistic cooperation and announced their plan for the north-targeted joint military exercises quite contrary to the trend of the times. 
					
					This tells the south Korean authorities are only paying lip-service to dialogue but, in actuality, pursuing confrontation and war.
					
					The logistic cooperation between south Korea and the U.S. is, in essence, cooperation in the war of aggression against the north.
					
					The huddle held by the south Korean military group with their American master over the war scenario goes to prove that they are not interested in dialogue and peace and the process to improve the inter-Korean relations at all but are bent on war preparations under the signboard of dialogue.
					
					 If they truly desire peace and denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula and the improved inter-Korean relations, they should take practical steps to stop all kinds of war confabs and saber-rattling against the north.

articles.title: Anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's Work Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Observed

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday dedicates a signed article to the 20th anniversary of the publication of President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Achieve the Great Unity of Our Nation".
					
					 The work, published on August 1, Juche 80 (1991), makes a Juche-oriented clarification of the issues of the nation and reunification and, on this basis, indicates the principle and ways for achieving the great unity of the Korean nation.
					
					 The President in his work explained that the great national unity is the basic premise for accomplishing the cause of the country's reunification and forms its essential contents, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 In the work he also taught that the driving force for the country's reunification is the entire Korean nation and the might of this driving force precisely means the might of the unity. It, at the same time, clarifies the ideological basis and fundamental principles of the great national unity.
					
					 The ideological basis of the great national unity clarified by the President is patriotism and the spirit of national independence and its fundamental principle calls on all the fellow countrymen to put the common interests of the nation above anything else and subordinate everything to the cause of the country's reunification irrespective of ideology, system and religion.
					
					 Over the past two decades the work has powerfully promoted the cause of the great unity of the Korean nation, firmly gripping the hearts of all Koreans aspiring after patriotism and independent reunification.
					
					 The dynamic advance of the June 15 era of reunification constitutes a powerful demonstration of the validity and vitality of the President's idea and line of great national unity. The President indicated the way of achieving the great unity of the nation with his outstanding ideological and theoretical wisdom, immensely broad magnanimity and ardent patriotism, thereby laying a solid groundwork for national reunification. This undying exploit will always shine with the history of the nation.
					
					 The historic work of the President serves as a banner of national unity which all Koreans should invariably uphold in the nation-wide struggle for independent reunification and peace and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Settlement of Lay-off Issue Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Twenty-three Christian organizations of south Korea including the Church Human Rights Center held a press conference outside the general building of the "government" in Seoul on July 25, demanding the puppet authorities settle the lay-off issue driving workers to death.
					
					 At the conference speakers charged that the police authorities cracked down by force on the actions of workers of the Hanjin Heavy Industries Co. Ltd., who opposed the lay-off system and called for the repeal of the part-time job system.
					
					 They lambasted the police for firing tear liquid containing toxic materials fatal to human body.
					
					 The workers' action for building a world free from part-time job and lay-off is running higher across south Korea, they stressed.
					
					 They urged the director of the Police Agency to step down after making an immediate apology for having used violence to put down the workers' action for vital rights.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak "government" should take a step to settle the lay-off issue threatening the life of workers and driving them to death, they held.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Suppression under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Suppression under Fire

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The Meeting of Victims of the "National Security Law" in south Korea held a rally in Puyo, South Chungchong Province on July 23 to condemn the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors' indiscriminate repression by dint of the fascist law.
					
					 In a statement the organization accused the Lee Myung Bak "government" of kicking off the suppressive racket against the progressive forces while violating the freedom of idea, expression and assembly by invoking the NSL.
					
					 An increasing number of people, who were indicted on charges of the violation of the NSL by the authorities, have been acquitted, it noted, adding this shows how indiscriminate and outrageous the suppression on the strength of the evil law is.
					
					 It also recalled that the repressive forces recently kicked off the crackdown on ten odd persons involved in the reunification movement by invoking the evil law.
					
					 If the authorities keep defining fellow countrymen as enemy and repressing the pro-reunification patriots and people, they will certainly face a punishment by the nation, it warned. 
					
					 The organization declared that it would wage a dynamic struggle to get the NSL, a target of world public criticism, abrogated and fight at the risk of their lives till the day of reunification.

articles.title: Japan Fans up Ambition to Grab Tok Islets
articles.content:
Japan Fans up Ambition to Grab Tok Islets

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries are set to open an exhibition at the shipbuilding museum in Tokyo that asserts Japan's claims to Tok Islets belonging to Korea, according to the south Korean paper Hangyore on July 29.
					
					 They displayed a model of Tok Islets, video asserting Japan's "dominium over the islets", map, pass to visit them and the like at the much-frequented place.
					
					 They declared that they would hold an exhibition on the theme of "Japan's sea-islets to be defended" for two months from August 1, openly insisting that the children and other people of Japan should be given understanding of its territorial lands and seas and it is needed to defend Japan's sea.
					
					 In the past there was an exhibition related to the issue of the islets in Shimane Prefecture of Japan under its own sponsorship. But this is the first time to open in Tokyo such exhibition as inciting the ambition to grab other country's territory, the paper said.
					
					 It was prompted by the sinister intention of the Japanese reactionaries to fan up a social atmosphere for grabbing the islets and thus seize the inviolable territory of the Korean nation and, furthermore, open the way for reinvasion of the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Deeply Revered by World Progressives
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Deeply Revered by World Progressives

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Progressive mankind deeply revered and praised President Kim Il Sung, a peerlessly great man, on the 17th anniversary of his demise.
					
					 Floral baskets were laid before his portraits in different countries and regions.
					
					 The king and the great king of Cambodia, the Foreign Ministry of Myanmar, the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist), the Communist Party of Peru (Red Motherland), the Revolutionary Socialist Party of Peru, the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, the Peruvian People's Women Union, the Cuban Institute of Friendship with the Peoples and the American Regional Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung sent floral baskets to the DPRK embassies in relevant countries. The Organization of Solidarity of the Peoples of Africa, Asia and Latin America laid a floral basket before the portrait of the smiling President.
					
					 Personages of various circles in different countries visited the DPRK missions and laid floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits of the President and made bows. They included the chairperson of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia, the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), the general secretary of the Arab Socialists' Movement of Syria, the general director for International Relations                     of the Iranian Workers' House, the chairman of the Preparatory Committee of Democratic Congo for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung, the chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and the secretary general of the All-India Indo-Korean Friendship Association. 
					
					 Statements were issued by the Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy, the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association, the chairman of the Central Committee of the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, the general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Vanguard of Costa Rica, the chairman of the Finland Mangyongdae Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung, the chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, the chairman of the Malta-Korea Friendship Association and other figures of political parties and organizations of different countries.
					
					 Praising the President as the most distinguished statesman in the 20th century recognized by the world, the statements said he is, indeed, an outstanding thinker and theoretician, invincible and iron-willed commander, peerlessly great man who greatly contributed to the national liberation movement in colonies and the cause of global independence and national hero who defended the destiny of Korea.
					
					 Seminars, remembrance meetings, lectures, book and photo exhibitions, film shows and other political and cultural events took place amid the growing yearnings for the President. The participants recalled with deep emotion the great life of the President who performed the undying feats which will shine long in human history.
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Unified Communist Party of Italy said that 17 years have passed since the President passed away but he is boundlessly revered by progressive mankind for his feats for the Korean revolution and the world revolution.
					
					 The feats of the President who founded the immortal Juche idea to illumine the path of independence and advance for mankind will shine long for all ages, said the chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 Foreign media reported about the boundless reverence of mankind for the President, the greatest man in the 20th century.
					
					 The Cuban paper Granma, the Russian paper Patriot, the German paper Rote Fahne, the Indonesian paper Suara Karya, the Ethiopian paper Daily Monitor, the Palestinian magazine Ilal Amam, the Internet homepage of the Korean Friendship Association, the Internet homepage of the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions and other media of various countries and international and regional organizations gave wide publicity to the feats of the President who built the fortress of independence in Korea and devoted his tireless efforts to winning a victory in the cause of global independence. His feats will shine long along with human history, they stressed.
					
					 The Preparatory Committee of Democratic Congo for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung, the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea, the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea, the Kim Jong Suk Library in Peru, the Brazil-Korea Friendship Association, the Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna, Austria, the Germany-DPRK Association and other organizations and bodies of different countries issued bulletins telling about the noble traits of the President who received party leaders and heads of state and prominent figures of many countries and worked heart and soul to build an independent new world.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet by Regional Body
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet by Regional Body

					Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions on July 26 posted on its Internet homepage the full text of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
					
					 The work, published on August 4, Juche 86 (1997), deals with the undying feats performed by President Kim Il Sung in accomplishing the cause of national reunification.
					
					 It also formulates the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo as the three charters for national reunification and indicates the tasks and ways for realizing national reunification on their basis.

articles.title: War Victory Day of DPRK Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
War Victory Day of DPRK Marked in Different Countries

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Events were held in different countries between July 23 and 27 to celebrate the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 They included meetings, photo exhibitions and film shows in South Africa and Laos and a lecture in Sweden.
					
					Displayed at the venues of exhibitions were photos showing the Songun leadership feats of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and the heroic struggle of the Korean army and people in the war.
					
					 Present at the events were officials of the Mfumalanga Provincial Committee of the South African Communist Party, the South African Association of Friendship and Solidarity with Korean People, the Laos-Korea Tin Company and the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and popular masses.
					
					  Appreciated at the shows were Korean films.

articles.title: Mexicans Support Korean People's Efforts
articles.content:
Mexicans Support Korean People's Efforts

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Nine political parties and organizations of Mexico including the People's Socialist Party made public a joint statement on July 25 to mark the 14th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
					
					 It is needed to continue stirring up the atmosphere of international support to the fair and aboveboard and realistic reunification proposals of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government on the occasion of August 4, the historic day when the work was published, the statement said.
					
					 The work is an immortal encyclopedia as it provides the basic guidelines for perfectly carrying forward and accomplishing the cause of national reunification started and wisely led by President Kim Il Sung who had conducted energetic activities for the reunification of the country, the supreme national desire of the Korean people, till the last moments of his life, it noted.
					
					 The three charters for national reunification formulated by Kim Jong Il are the basic cornerstone of the movement for national reunification and an immortal great reunification programme that comprehended the idea of "By our nation itself" and the idea of independent reunification, the statement stressed.
					
					 Bitterly denouncing the Lee Myung Bak group of south Korea for its hideous provocations, sycophancy and treachery, moves for confrontation with fellow countrymen and anti-reunification crimes, it said:
					
					 It called upon the political parties, governments and organizations of the world desirous of Korea's reunification to strongly condemn the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for its anti-DPRK moves and continue powerfully supporting the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people in the struggle to achieve the national reunification under the three charters.

articles.title: Experimental Orbiter Launched in China
articles.content:
Experimental Orbiter Launched in China

					 Beijing, July 31 (KCNA) -- China successfully launched the SJ-11-02 orbiter into space on July 29.
					
					 The orbiter was launched on a Long March II-C carrier rocket at the Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center.
					
					 It will be reportedly used to conduct scientific experiments in space.

articles.title: Iranian Majlis Speaker Blasts Plots of US and West
articles.content:
Iranian Majlis Speaker Blasts Plots of U.S. and West

					Tehran, July 31 (KCNA) -- Speaker of the Iranian Majlis Ali Larijani at a ceremony on July 25 bitterly chided the plots of the U.S. and the West against Islam.
					
					 The U.S. and other Western countries are clinging to political stratagem to mislead the understanding of Islam but this is futile, he added.
					
					 The Muslims do not require any political allurement trick of the West but will protect their legitimate rights and independence under any circumstances, he declared.

articles.title: Egyptian FM Accuses Israel of Its Move to Expand Settlements
articles.content:
Egyptian FM Accuses Israel of Its Move to Expand Settlements

					 Cairo, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Egyptian foreign minister at a press conference on July 27 accused Israel of its move to expand the Jewish settlements.
					
					 As regards the Israeli authorities' decision to build new Jewish settlements in the West Bank, he termed it a deliberate behavior ignoring the peaceful settlement of the Mideast issue.
					
					 The construction of Jewish settlements in the occupied territories of Palestine is illegal from A to Z, he noted, stressing that the above-said move of Israel is bound to go bust.

articles.title: Iran Re-clarifies Its Stand to Co ntinue Pushing ahead with Its Nuclear Program
articles.content:
Iran Re-clarifies Its Stand to Continue Pushing ahead with Its Nuclear Program

					 Tehran, July 31 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Salehi at an interview with a news agency on July 28 re-clarified the government's stand to continue pushing forward its nuclear development for peaceful purposes.
					
					 Nuclear technology is the most essential for achieving the country's development, he said, adding neither pressure nor threat on the part of the West can stop Iran from its nuclear development. Iran will never give up its nuclear development for peaceful purposes, he declared.

articles.title: Cooperation among Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Different Countries

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Kenya and Uganda on July 27 agreed to resume the work to determine the borderline between the two countries.
					
					 China and Singapore agreed to develop bilateral cooperative relations in various fields on the same day.

articles.title: Deputy Chief of Iranian Mission at UN Accuses Israel and West
articles.content:
Deputy Chief of Iranian Mission at UN Accuses Israel and West

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The deputy chief of the Iranian mission at the UN, speaking at a meeting of the UNSC on July 28, scathingly accused Israel and the West.
					
					 One of the basic causes of the instable situation in the Middle East lies in the Israeli policy of aggression and occupation, he said, adding that peace will never settle in the region as long as the Israeli authorities keep pursuing this policy.
					
					 He condemned the West for defending and patronizing Israel's crimes against Palestinians. He called upon the international community to take steps to put an end to the Israeli blockade against the Gaza Strip and check Israeli nuclear activities, a threat to the regional peace and security.

articles.title: Russia Hit by Forest Fires
articles.content:
Russia Hit by Forest Fires

					 Moscow, July 31 (KCNA) -- Forest fires broke out in Russia, causing damage.
					
					 Hard hit is the northwestern area of Russia, which accounts for nearly 80 percent of sources of forest fires throughout it.
					
					10,000 hectares of forests are burning in Arkhangelsk Region alone and forest fires broke out in the Republic of Komi and Moscow, Vladimir and Ryazan regions.
					
					 Emergency steps are being taken to extinguish forest fires in the afflicted areas.

articles.title: Motor Enterprises of Japan Suffer Loss
articles.content:
Motor Enterprises of Japan Suffer Loss

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Hino Motors Ltd. reported Tuesday a group net loss of 4.89 billion yen for the April-June quarter.
					
					 Nissan Motor Co. said Wednesday its group net profit in the April-June period fell 20.3 percent from a year before.

articles.title: China Prepares for Universiad
articles.content:
China Prepares for Universiad

					 Beijing, July 31 (KCNA) -- Liu Yandong, a state councilor of China, called for making preparations to host the Universiad as a high-level sports and cultural festival.
					
					 Liu, who is also a member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, toured Shenzhen on July 23 to 24 to inspect preparations for the games.
					
					 Through the games, China should fully demonstrate the mental and moral traits of its civilized, energetic and vigorous students and promote understanding and friendship among university students all over the world, she added.

articles.title: CPC Calls for Careful Selection of Cadres
articles.content:
CPC Calls for Careful Selection of Cadres

					 Beijing, July 31 (KCNA) -- The General Office of the C.C., the Communist Party of China (CPC) recently released rules concerning the selection of city-level senior officials.
					
					 The rules call for giving priority to a moral character in selecting cadres and taking into consideration their style of work, sense of discipline and degree of integrity. 
					
					 They also lay emphasis on improving the selection and appointment system of city-level cadres.

articles.title: Russia Announces Grain Export Plan
articles.content:
Russia Announces Grain Export Plan

					 Moscow, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Russian government recently announced a plan to export 18 million-20 million tonnes of grain this year. 
					
					 The country has already exported 1.5 million tonnes of grain after resuming the temporarily suspended grain export on July 1. 
					
					 The government also reportedly adopted decisions to render humanitarian assistance to some countries, including the DPRK.

articles.title: History Education Is Urgent: Russian President
articles.content:
History Education Is Urgent: Russian President

					 Moscow, July 31 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev recently called upon the country's schools to intensify education in history.
					
					 Addressing a meeting, he said it is urgent for schools to properly teach history. 
					
					 Events of the Second World War should not be reviewed in an improper way in school textbooks, he added.

articles.title: Cattle Fed with Irradiated Rice Straws in Japan
articles.content:
Cattle Fed with Irradiated Rice Straws in Japan

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- It has been disclosed that cattle fed with rice straws contaminated with radioactive cesium appeared in market in Miyagi Prefecture, Japan.
					
					 In this regard, the governor of the prefecture submitted a document to the government on July 25, urging it to set up a system necessary for examining all cattle.

articles.title: New President Inaugurated in Peru
articles.content:
New President Inaugurated in Peru

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Ollanta Humala was sworn in as Peruvian president on July 28 in front of the parliament building.
					
					 The new presidential term ends in 2016.

articles.title: Russia Adopts Federal Law to Combat Illegal Gambling
articles.content:
Russia Adopts Federal Law to Combat Illegal Gambling

					 Moscow, July 31 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev signed a federal law for preventing illegal gambling. 
					
					 The law had been adopted at the State Duma on July 6 and approved by the Federation Council on July 13. 
					
					 The new law is aimed to strictly punish those engaging in illegal gambling and ensure unity of application of law and justice over such illegal practice.

articles.title: Cuban Leader Calls for Combating Economic Crimes
articles.content:
Cuban Leader Calls for Combating Economic Crimes

					 Hanava, July 31 (KCNA) -- Raul Castro, president of the Council of State of Cuba, recently presided over a cabinet session, calling for strengthening supervision over the major economic sectors and invigorating the struggle against economic crimes.
					
					 All of the law enforcement officials should play a crucial role in combating economic crimes, he said. Anyone who violated law should be brought to justice.

articles.title: Pakistani Talks with India Termed Productive
articles.content:
Pakistani Talks with India Termed Productive

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Pakistani Foreign Minister Hina Rabbani Khar on July 28 described the talks with her Indian counterpart S. M. Krishna productive and result-oriented.   
					
					 Khar said both countries shared the same view that there is no alternative to dialogue process. 
					
					 The dialogue process should be uninterrupted and uninterruptible, she added.

articles.title: Venezuelan President Proposes New Slogan
articles.content:
Venezuelan President Proposes New Slogan

					 Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Hugo Chavez Frias, president of Venezuela, set a new revolutionary slogan.
					
					 Addressing a mass meeting on July 28, he suggested changing the traditional slogan "Socialist motherland or death" into "Socialist motherland, victory, let's remain alive and emerge victorious!"

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe mensaje de consuelo de Hu Jintao
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe mensaje de consuelo de Hu Jintao

					Pyongyang, 1 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea recibio un mensaje de consuelo que le dirigiera el dia 29 Hu Jintao, Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y Presidente de la Republica Popular China.
					
					El mensaje senala como abajo:
					
					Recibi la noticia de que recientemente en algunas zonas de Corea se produjeron las perdidas humanas y de bienes por graves inundaciones.
					
					En representacion del gobierno y el pueblo de China, expreso mi profunda compasion y verdaderas condolencias a Usted y por su conducto, al gobierno y el pueblo de Corea.
					
					Estoy convencido de que el pueblo coreano recupere los graves danos causados por inundaciones y goce de una vida estable bajo la potente direccion del camarada Secretario General, el Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el gobierno coreano.

articles.title: China decide facilitar materiales de socorro urgente a Corea
articles.content:
China decide facilitar materiales de socorro urgente a Corea

					Pyongyang, 1 de agosto (ACNC) -- El gobierno de la Republica Popular China y la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja de China decidieron facilitar los materiales de socorro urgente a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en relacion con que esta ha sufrido los danos por inundaciones.
					
					Esto estimulara grandemente al pueblo coreano levantado en la labor para eliminar los danos en las zonas damnificadas.

articles.title: MINREX se refiere al resultado de conversaciones RPDC-EE.UU.
articles.content:
MINREX se refiere al resultado de conversaciones RPDC-EE.UU.

					Pyongyang, 1 de agosto (ACNC) -- Con respecto a que tuvieron lugar en Nueva York, las conversaciones de alto nivel entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Estados Unidos, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio el dia primero la siguiente respuesta a la ACNC: 
					
					Por invitacion del gobierno estadounidense, la delegacion de la RPDC encabezada por el primer viceministro de RR.EE., Kim Kye Gwan, sostuvo los 28 y 29 de julio en Nueva York las conversaciones de alto nivel con la delegacion de los Estados Unidos de America presidida por el representante especial para la politica sobre Corea, Stephen Bosworth. 
					
					En la cita se discutieron profundamente en un ambiente sincero y constructivo los problemas sobre la mejora de las relaciones RPDC-EE.UU., la estabilidad de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y la reanudacion de las conversaciones a 6 bandas. 
					
					Ambas partes reconocieron que mejorar las relaciones entre los dos paises y promover la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana mediante las negociaciones y por via pacifica conviene a los intereses de los respectivos paises y acordaron continuar el dialogo. 
					
					Es invariable la posicion de la RPDC de reanudar pronto e incondicionalmente las conversaciones a 6 bandas y ejecutar globalmente la Declaracion Conjunta del 19 de Septiembre en el principio de accion simultanea.

articles.title: Inaugurada la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang"
articles.content:
Inaugurada la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang"

					Pyongyang, 1 de agosto (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 63o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, quedo inaugurada con solemnidad el lunes por la noche en el capitalino Estadio Primero de Mayo la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang" laureada con el Premio Kim Il Sung.
					
					La primera version de la funcion fue estrenada en Corea en 2002.
					
					 El colectivo creador realizo nuevas obras que demuestran la orgullosa figura de la patria y las fuerzas espirituales del Ejercito Popular de Corea y el pueblo coreano que registran eventos sorprendentes bajo la direccion del gran partido.
					
					 La vieron los secretarios del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam y Choe Ryong Hae, el vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros Kang Nung Su, los funcionarios de las entidades de masas, ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del EPC junto con los trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					 Fueron invitados ahi los compatriotas en ultramar y los huespedes extranjeros.
					
					 El ministro de Cultura An Tong Chun subrayo en su discurso inaugural que la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang" dara al EPC y al pueblo coreano nuevas fuerzas y coraje y demostrara al exterior y al interior la figura de la Corea socialista unida monoliticamente, las inteligencias y talentos de la nacion coreana.
					
					 Cuando comenzo a sonar la cancion "El ideal de el", se inscribieron en la pizarra humana las frases "Rendimos el maximo homenaje al gran Lider, Padre de la nacion", "Rendimos el maximo honor al gran Dirigente, camarada Kim Jong Il", etc.
					
					Al mismo tiempo, quedo comenzada la funcion con la oleada de bailarines que portaban flores en sus manos.
					
					 Los ejecutantes describieron en escenas epicas las hazanas realizadas por el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il ante la epoca y la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo y la lucha de todo el ejercito y el pueblo coreanos que crean milagros y meritos en el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo y la construccion de un Estado prospero.
					
					 Los espectadores aplaudieron efusivamente a los ejecutantes que escenificaron una maravilla del arte con sus ritmos elegantes, energicos movimientos gimnasticos y pizarra humana en perfecta combinacion con modernos aparatos acusticos y de iluminacion, paneles electricos que daban efectos tridimensionales.

articles.title: Entidad juvenil norcoreana apoya la lucha por reducir cuota de matricula
articles.content:
Entidad juvenil norcoreana apoya la lucha por reducir cuota de matricula

					Pyongyang, 1 de agosto (ACNC) -- El portavoz de la Subcomision de los Jovenes y Estudiantes del Comite Norteno por la Ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio hizo publica la vispera la siguiente declaracion:
					
					 En estos dias, se expande rapidamente a todo el territorio surcoreano la lucha de estudiantes, jovenes y otros sectores por la solucion del problema de la cuota de matriculacion en la universidad.
					
					 La reduccion a la mitad de tal cuota fue una promesa de elecciones "presidenciales" del traidor Lee Myung Bak quien habia hecho a las familias surcoreanas que la alcanzaria con los subsidios a las universidades.
					
					  Pero, cuando llego al poder, incumplio esa promesa y convirtio el Sur de Corea en un lugar de fondos exorbitantes de matricula privando a los estudiantes y jovenes del derecho a estudiar.
					
					  Encolerizada por ello, los jovenes y estudiantes surcoreanos iniciaron una intensa lucha reclamando la reduccion a la mitad de la cuota de matricula, a la cual se suman numerosas entidades civiles y sociales como la Participacion Solidaria de Ciudadanos por la Sociedad Democratica, Sindicato Nacional de Ensenantes  y la Asociacion Nacional de Padres por la Educacion Verdadera y hasta los partidos opositores.
					
					   La Subcomision de los Jovenes y Estudiantes del Comite Norteno por la Ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio se solidariza totalmente y apoya calidamente junto con todos los estudiantes y jovenes de la RPDC la lucha de aquellos contra la antipopular politica de educacion de la camarilla del traidor Lee Myung Bak.
					
					  Los jovenes y estudiantes surcoreanos son los que sufren mas desgracias y penas bajo la dominacion del traidor Lee Myung Bak y el "Gran Partido Nacional".
					
					  Impotentes de sufragar los gastos de estudio que crecen de modo exorbitante cada ano, numerosos estudiantes piden la baja o trabajan duro en horas extraescolares para ganarse la cuota de matricula.
					
					  ?Y cuantos son los que se suicidan reclamando un mundo sin esa cuota y los padres que hacen lo mismo dejando el testamento a sus hijos de que les perdonaran por no poderles cubrir los enormes gastos de educacion?
					
					  El crimen mas grande e injustificable es privar a los jovenes llenos de suenos del mas valioso y prioritario derecho a estudiar, en vez de infundirles esperanza y vitalidad.
					
					  Los acontecimientos tragicos en torno a la asesina cuota de matricula, que se reportan ultimamente en todas partes del suelo surcoreano, comprueban que el Sur de Corea bajo la dominacion del traidor Lee Myung Bak y el "Gran Partido Nacional" es la tierra de vida popular depauperada y derechos civiles ultrajados y la sociedad obscura sin futuro.
					
					  Dejando intacta a la camarilla de Lee que es capaz de todas las maldades como embaucar y burlarse de la poblacion surcoreana para robar y mantener el poder, no sera realizada nunca la reivindicacion de los jovenes, estudiantes y otros sectores del Sur de Corea sobre la reduccion a mitad de la cuota ni su sueno y felicidad de futuro.
					
					  Ahora ponen en seria crisis politica a la camarilla del traidor Lee las huelgas, manifestaciones, mitines con velas y la campana de recogida de firmas de un millon que se libran en diferentes localidades por la misma reivindicacion.
					
					  Volviendo a tomar conciencia de su papel y responsabilidad de vanguardia de la lucha, la justiciera y valiente juventud surcoreana debera dinamizar su lucha solidarizandose firmemente con diferentes sectores por arruinar al traidor Lee y al "Gran Partido Nacional", que imponen indecibles desgracias y penas al pueblo enganandolo con falsa promesa electoral, y construir un nuevo mundo donde no haya los gastos de matricula y todos puedan llevar una vida de verdad aprendiendo a todo querer.

articles.title: Entidad nortena denuncia politica antipopular del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Entidad nortena denuncia politica antipopular del Sur de Corea

					Pyongyang, 1 de agosto (ACNC) -- En relacion con que se libra en el Sur de Corea la lucha de los jovenes, estudiantes y habitantes de distintos sectores por la solucion del problema de la  matricula del curso en la universidad, el portavoz de la subcomision de los profesores y empleados del Comite Norteno para la Ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio hizo publica el dia primero la siguiente declaracion:
					
					En estos dias, se expande rapidamente a todo el territorio surcoreano la lucha de estudiantes, jovenes y habitantes de distintos sectores de denuncia a la banda titere que hizo una promesa falsa de reducir a la mitad la carga de gastos educacionales de los estudiantes y sus padres invirtiendo fondos a las universidades, y de demanda a la baja de la  matricula del curso en la universidad.
					
					Esta lucha por obtener la libertad y los derechos de estudiar pisoteados por la politica de educacion antipopular del "poder" actual se convierte en la lucha masiva bajo el apoyo y la solidaridad de mas de 550 organizaciones civicas y sociales de distintos sectores del Sur de Corea y eleva cada dia mas el ambiente de protesta como la  manifestacion, mitin con velas y la campana de recogida de firmas de un millon gritando "!Pais loco de matricula del curso, vamos a cambiarlo!"
					
					La subcomision de los profesores y empleados del Comite Norteno por la Ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio expresa, junto con todos los educadores y habitantes de la RPDC, el entero apoyo a la justa lucha de jovenes, estudiantes y habitantes surcoreanos de distintos sectores.
					
					La demanda al estudio es derecho universal del hombre.
					
					Pero, las autoridades titeres no cumplieron la promesa de reducir a la mitad tal cuota que habia publicado con bombo e impidieron el camino de estudio de los jovenes y estudiantes con la matricula del curso acarreando dolores y desdichas a los habitantes.  
					
					 ?Cuantos son las lagrimas de sangre derramadas por los estudiantes que fueron rechazados de sus universidades sin poder sufragar los crecientes gastos anuales de estudio y trabajan con exceso para obtener los gastos de matricula, y los que cayeron rindiendose por el trabajo duro y protestaron al mundo con el suicidio?
					
					?Y cuantos son los padres que se suicidaron condenando a los gobernantes titeres tras pasar los tiempos con depresiones y lagrimas por la preocupacion de gastos de educacion de sus hijos?
					
					La matricula del curso, producto inevitable de la politica de educacion antipopular de la banda titere  arrebata y pisotea el deseo y el derecho al estudio, y acarrea a los jovenes, estudiantes y otros habitantes  la desesperacion y la muerte.
					
					Debido al costoso gasto educacional, los jovenes y sus padres se encuentran inquietos y pierden sus vidas sin poder contener la ira. Esta realidad tragica comprueba elocuentemente que el Sur de Corea es el infierno de vida del pueblo y derechos civiles y la sociedad obscura sin futuro.
					
					La realidad demuestra fehacientemente que nunca se lograran el sueno de estudio de los estudiantes, el deseo de los padres sobre el radiante futuro de sus hijos y el verdadero derecho de los habitantes mientras permanezca la banda de traidores que se entrega a mantener y prolongar su "poder" no haciendo caso de los intereses del pueblo.
					
					Ya no tenemos nada que esperar de la banda titere que solo acarrea innumerables desagracias y sufrimientos a los habitantes surcoreanos mediante las promesas falsas y el engano a la opinion publica. 
					
					Al avivar mas la lucha por reducir a medias la matricula del curso, el pueblo surcoreano de diferentes estratos debe derrocar a la banda titere, colectivo traidor sin precedente en la historia, y obtener cuanto antes la democracia, los derechos civiles y la vida verdadera.
